Price is the Key

Thanks for the review Wez. I've been tempted, time to time, to get a Kindle.

Price is the big holdback, because in the end, I don't see myself being able to buy something like this, without having two of them, so my wife & I wouldn't have to share. (IE, her going on a trip and taking it, and therefore leaving me without my book I was reading)

I also have a 'dream'. This dream, would involve a kindle-like device, that would have both audio & text versions of the same book. And allow you to easily switch back and forth between them.

So I could hop in the car for a drive, and have it read me the next 2 chapters. Then curl up in bed in the evening and be reading the text from where it left off. Lemme know when that is available :)

it does audio too

The kindle does have audiobook support (and experimental mp3 player), but I've not tried it... yes, it would be very cool to have it seamlessly read you the book while in the car.

I'm not an audiobook person; I quite enjoy reading in a quiet room and find listening to spoken words harder than reading. I think it's because I can read much faster than people tend to speak, so listening takes more time per sentence and I find that I have to really divert attention to listen effectively when anything worth listening to is going on.

Yes, I think the price is still a bit high, and I've heard that some significant advances in the screen technology have been made this past year; I think it won't be long before the price goes down and we get even better devices.
